content:
• Thursday, June 14, 2018
  • NXPI

    NXP +8.3% on report China has OK'd Qualcomm deal

    • NXP Semiconductors (NASDAQ:NXPI) is jumping after hours, up 8.3%, as the South China Morning Post reports that Chinese regulators have approved Qualcomm's $44B buyout of the company.
    • Qualcomm (NASDAQ:QCOM) is up 2.2% after hours.
    • That clears the final hurdle, according to the report, as China is the last of nine nations that had to sign off on the merger.
    • But timing of the deal, or what assets Qualcomm might have agreed to give up to seal it, are still unknown.
    • Previously: NXP Semiconductors -1.8% after Senate pushback on ZTE ban lift (Jun. 12 2018)
    • Previously: Qualcomm extends tender offer for NXP, tendered shares drop (Jun. 08 2018)
     
     
     
     
    | 6:36 PM | 131 Comments
  • GSAT

    Globalstar ordered to produce witness in merger suit

    • Globalstar (NYSEMKT:GSAT) has been ordered to produce a witness for a June 21 deposition in a lawsuit filed by one of its investors, Bloomberg reports.
    • Shares are 2.3% lower after hours.
    • Jason Mudrick and Mudrick Capital Management sued the company in May over a planned merger with FiberLight and other assets also controlled by Globalstar chief Jay Monroe, calling it a "self-dealing" transaction.
    • Mudrick had converted into an activist investor the month before, on a quest to prevent the company from taking additional financing from Monroe's Thermo Companies.
    • Mudrick now says it needs a witness for the "limited purpose of testifying to the existence and volume of the documents sought in plaintiff’s demand."
     
     
     
     
    | 6:18 PM
  • VSTM

    After Hours Gainers / Losers (06/14/2018)

    • Top gainers: VSTM +6.5%. VNCE +3.5%. HUYA +3.3%. BRFS +3.0%. KB +2.4%.
    • Top Losers: DEST -3.7%. ADBE -3.4%.  AI -2.8%. EQS -2.1%. APRN -1.6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:35 PM | 9 Comments
  • TWX

    Time Warner +1.5% as U.S. won't seek stay on AT&T deal

    • Time Warner (NYSE:TWX) has jumped 1.5% postmarket as AT&T notes in a court order that the U.S. won't seek a stay to prevent its $85B buyout from closing, Bloomberg reports.
    • The two sides are agreeing to end the waiting period in order to get the deal closed.
    • In the filing, AT&T says it won't have a role in setting pricing at Time Warner's Turner networks -- a sticking point in the government's antitrust trial -- and that it will manage Turner as a separate business unit.
    • Dozens of blocks of Time Warner shares have moved around the current postmarket quote of $100.28.
    • In late trading, T is down 0.1%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:22 PM | 87 Comments
  • CHMA

    Chiasma halfway there in late-stage study of octreotide in acromegaly; shares up 6% after hours

    • Thinly traded nano cap Chiasma (NASDAQ:CHMA) is up 6% after hours on light volume on the heels of its announcement that its Phase 3 clinical trial, OPTIMAL, is 50% enrolled. The study is assessing octreotide capsules in adults with acromegaly.
    • Randomization should be completed by year-end with topline data expected in Q4 2019.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:53 PM | 2 Comments

    • Castle Brands (NYSEMKT:ROX): Q4 EPS of $0.00 misses by $0.01.

    • Shares +1.57%.

  • VSTM

    Verastem to raise $43M via direct stock sale; shares up 6% after hours

    • Verastem (NASDAQ:VSTM) is up 6% after hours in response to its planned direct sale of ~7.2M common shares at $6.00 per share to funds managed by Consonance Capital. Gross proceeds will be ~$43M. Closing date is June 18.
    • Today's close was $5.58.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:46 PM | 24 Comments
  • JBL

    Jabil +2.3% on Q3 beats, upside revenue guidance

    • Jabil (NYSE:JBL) shares are up 2.3% aftermarket on Q3 results that beat EPS and revenue estimates with a 21% Y/Y revenue growth. Q4 guidance has upside revenue of $5.2B to $5.6B (consensus: $5.19B) and in-line EPS of $0.56 to $0.80 (consensus: $0.68).
    • Key metrics: Cash flow from operating activities, $144M; cash and equivalents, $677.5M; SG&A spend, $252.5M; R&D spend, $10.1M. 
    • Share repurchase: Jabil’s board approves an additional repurchase program of up to $350M in common stock. Authorization expires August 31, 2019. 
    • Earnings call was scheduled for 4:30 PM Eastern with a webcast/replay available here. 
    • Press release.    
    • Previously: Jabil beats by $0.01, beats on revenue (June 14)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:41 PM | 1 Comment
  • CNC

    New York AG on board with Centene takeover of Fidelis Care; shares up 2% after hours

    • Centene (NYSE:CNC) announces that the New York Attorney General has signed off on its planned acquisition of New York Medicaid services provider Fidelis Care. The company expects the transaction to close by the end of the month.
    • Shares are up 2% after hours.
    • Previously: Centene to acquire Fidelis Care for $3.75B; shares up 1% after hours (Sept. 12, 2017)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:39 PM
  • ADBE

    Adobe Systems -3% despite Q2 beats (update)

    • Adobe Systems (NASDAQ:ADBE) drops 3% aftermarket on Q2 results that beat EPS and revenue estimates with a 24% Y/Y revenue growth. Upside Q3 guidance from the conference call transcript has revenue at $2.24B (consensus: $2.22B) and EPS at $1.68 (consensus: $1.64).
    • Key metrics: Digital Media revenue, $1.55B; Digital Media Annualized Recurring Revenue, $6.06B; Digital Experience revenue, $586M; cash flow from operations, $976M; deferred revenue, $2.63B; operating expenses, $1.22B; cash and equivalents, $2.99B.
    • Earnings call is scheduled for 5 PM Eastern with a webcast available here.
    • Press release.
    • Previously: Adobe Systems beats by $0.12, beats on revenue (June 14)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:23 PM | 20 Comments

    Genco Shipping launches share offering

    • Genco Shipping (NYSE:GNK) -5.9% after-hours on news it has commenced a public offering of common stock; no other details are provided related to the size of the offering.
    • GNK says it plans to use the proceeds for future vessel acquisitions.

  • TNTR-OLD

    Tintri +37.8% on high volume

    • Tintri (NASDAQ:TNTR-OLD) gains 37.8% to $0.73 on higher volume.
    • Volume sits near 6.9M compared to the 1.18M three-month average.

  • FB

    Facebook's public face exits role

    • Elliot Schrage -- Facebook's (FB +2.2%) VP of communications and public policy -- is exiting the company.
    • He's been with Facebook for a decade and has faced criticism lately amid a series of public controversies for the social networking giant.
    • “Leading policy and communications for hyper growth technology companies is a joy — but it’s also intense and leaves little room for much else," Schrage says. "Mark (Zuckerberg), Sheryl (Sandberg) and I have been discussing this for a while.“
    • Schrage had previously been VP of communications and public affairs for Google.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:27 PM | 15 Comments
  • SPOT

    Deutsche Bank: Spotify isn't 'Netflix 2.0'

    • Deutsche Bank is struggling with the bull case on Spotify (NYSE:SPOT) even as it stays positive on music companies overall.
    • "We do not think Spotify is Netflix 2.0," says analyst Lloyd Walmsley, who's started coverage at Hold, pointing to a lack of visibility on its long-term margins and a lack of differentiated proprietary content. He'd prefer to invest on streaming tailwinds via major labels like Vivendi (OTCPK:VIVHY) instead. (h/t Bloomberg)
    • Walmsley has a price target of $155, implying 13.6% downside from the current $179.65.
    • Investors aren't nonplussed by the new rating, moving shares up 5.2% on the day to their new all-time high.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:07 PM | 5 Comments

  • VSLR

    Vivint Solar +26% since closing $811M in new financing

    • Vivint Solar (VSLR +12.4%) continues to power higher, capping a 26% surge following Monday's news that it closed $811M in new financing through two separate transactions.
    • VSLR says the proceeds from the financings will be used to help repay existing debt facilities  and for general corporate purposes.
    • VSLR says the transactions lower its blended total credit spreads by ~160 bps.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:45 PM | 7 Comments
  • BLBD

    Blue Bird rallies after buyback disclosure

    • Blue Bird (NASDAQ:BLBD) is up 8.92% after the company's board approves a share buyback allowance of $25M.
    • Shares of Blue Bird broke back over $20 for the first time since late May.
    • Previously: Blue Bird announces authorization of a $25M stock repurchase program (June 14)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:40 PM
  • BLCM

    Bellicum Pharma continues rally, up 6%

    • Bellicum Pharmaceuticals (BLCM +6.4%) regains it upward momentum, albeit on below-average volume. Shares have rallied 50% since early May.
    • On Saturday, June 16, there will be two presentations of BPX-501 data at the European Hematology Association Congress in Stockholm.

  • BOXL

    Boxlight set to join Russell Microcap Index

    • Boxlight (BOXL +4.2%) is set to join the Russell Microcap Index at the conclusion of the Russell U.S. Indexes annual reconstitution.
    • The move is effective after the market opens on June 25.
    • "We are honored to be added to the Russell Microcap Index to raise Boxlight’s visibility and public awareness within the investment community," said Michael Pope, President of Boxlight.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:01 PM

  • DISCA

    Discovery announces new Manhattan HQ

    • Discovery (DISCA +3.6%) has officially selected a new Flatiron district building in Manhattan as its new global headquarters.
    • The company will consolidate locations at 230 Park Ave. South, planning to start moving in fall 2019 after a series of renovations, and continuing through mid-2020.
    • The building has about 250,000 square feet; Discovery had been leasing about 160,000 square feet in Manhattan.
    • In January, the company said it planned to relocate headquarters from Silver Spring, Md. (where it owns a 550,000-square-foot building) to New York City. And in March, reports surprisingly showed Discovery leaning toward the Flatiron district building.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:51 PM
  • BRFS

    Former Petrobras CEO Parente could take helm at Brazil's BRF

    • Brazilian food processor BRF (BRFS +4.2%) shoots higher after former Petrobras CEO Pedro Parente reportedly is asked to run the company.
    • Parente already is BRF's chairman, a post he took in April when BRF shareholders sought a management overhaul in the wake of a food safety probe that caused plant closures.
    • Parente has a six-month non-compete agreement from Petrobras, Reuters reports, and would need clearance from a government commission to be able to take on the BRF job while in effect.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:05 PM | 1 Comment
  • TCI

    Financials - Top Gainers / Losers as of 1:00 PM (06/14/2018)

    • Gainers: TCI +13%. FANH +10%.
    • Losers: BMA -12%. SUPV -10%. OXBR -8%. GGAL -7%. LOOP -7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:00 PM
  • NTDOY

    Nintendo slipping further after E3 lineup

    • Nintendo (NTDOY -3.5%) is on its second day sharply lower -- and heading for its worst month as a stock in years -- after an E3 presentation that has come off as a dud.
    • Reggie Fils-Aime, head of the company's U.S. operations, says analysts are wrong in sentiment that the company is out of surprises, and says aside from what it announced at E3, there's more to come "in the weeks and months ahead."
    • Analysts like Ace Research's Hideki Yasuda criticized the game lineup Nintendo unveiled as weak on third-party publisher content: "Something was lacking." And the company's planned December release of Super Smash Bros. Ultimate is coming later than expected.
    • Even so, Yasuda says the company's internal content (including Super Mario Party and new Pokemon) should create solid sales momentum.
    • “As you look at Nintendo over these many years, if you look at the number of analysts who have actually gotten it right, it’s fairly small," Fils-Aime told Bloomberg. "And it’s because we as a company, we hold things close to the vest. We love to surprise the overall community and environment, and when we surprise, we surprise big.”
    • Shares are now down 9.1% in U.S. trading over a two-day span.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:50 PM | 18 Comments
  • AGMH

    Midday Gainers / Losers (06/14/2018)

    • Gainers: AGMH +79%. FLKS +48%. ETSY +30%. DEST +27%. THST +26%. NITE +20%. DBX +18%. INSY +16%. CLPS +12%. LIVX +13%.
    • Losers: TLRD -22%. SNOA -21%. ACHV -19%. CLRO -18%. MIK -18%. CULP -13%. BMA -12%. MKGI -12%. BITA -12%. NNDM -11%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:49 PM
  • TCI

    Transcontinental Realty Investors announces strategic initiatives; Shares jumps 11%

    • Transcontinental Realty Investors (TCI +10.9%) has entered into a Joint Venture with a major NYSE financial institution. This joint venture agreement conveys existing multifamily assets as well as projects under development to a newly-formed entity called Victory Abode Apartments, LLC.
    • The assets involved include 41 existing properties and 12 properties under development encompassing 8,082 apartment units, with the rights to jointly develop 23 additional projects.
    • The company's second major strategic transaction of the year is the planned sale of its 4 commercial office buildings to a private company with significant real estate holdings.
    • The sale of these commercial assets is tied to the NOI calculation at the end of the ~45 day due diligence period. TCI is confident that the asset values will remain attractive to all parties.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 12:44 PM
  • DBX

    Dropbox +19.4% on high volume

    • Dropbox (NASDAQ:DBX) gains 19.4% towards an all-time high on higher volume of roughly 12.7M compared to the 4.12M average volume.
    • Dropbox shares are up 1.4% in the past week, 5.7% in the past month, and 11.2% YTD since the March IPO.       
    • Competitor Box (NYSE:BOX) is also getting a boost with shares up 3.4% to $27.02.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:42 PM | 21 Comments
  • CHTR

    GCI Liberty prices debenture offering; GLIBA +3, CHTR +3.5%

    • GCI Liberty (GLIBA +3%) has priced its private offering of $415M in 1.75% exchangeable senior debentures due 2046.
    • Purchasers have an option to buy additional debentures up to an aggregate $62.25M.
    • When debentures are exchanged, GCI Liberty has the option of delivering Charter (NASDAQ:CHTR) Class A common stock, cash, or a combination of those.
    • Initially, 2.6989 shares of Charter Class A common stock is attributable to each $1,000 in debentures (initial exchange price of $370.52 per share).
    • Charter shares are up 3.5% today to $295.07.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:38 PM
  • CULP

    Culp down 14% on Q4 results

    • Culp (CULP -14%) reported Q4 net sales of $78.2M (+1.1% Y/Y). Segment sales: Mattress fabric $46.5M (-4.7% Y/Y) and upholstery fabric $31.7M (+11% Y/Y).
    • Q4 Overall operating margin declined by 100 bps to 8.3%. Segment operating margins: Mattress fabric declined by 150 bps to 13.1% and upholstery fabric declined by 200 bps to 13.4%.
    • Q4 Adj. EBITDA margin declined by 170 bps to 10.51%.
    • Cash flow from operations $27.5M, down by 24.6% Y/Y.
    • Culp announced acquisition of eLuxury, an internet company offering bedding accessories and home goods direct to consumers. The acquisition will help Culp expand addressable market and add a new sales channel. eLuxury’s revenue is on a current annual run rate of $22M for 2018.
    • “As we look ahead to fiscal 2019, we are facing a significant challenge with the growth in imported Chinese mattresses and its effect on fabric demand from many of our customers. We are aware of actions being considered by the industry to address this situation in the near term, and we are optimistic that such actions will be successful”, said Frank Saxon, President and CEO.
    • 1Q19 Outlook: Sales to be down ~10% Y/Y; pre-tax income $3.8-4.8M and Capex $6-7M.
    • Previously: Culp misses by $0.06, misses on revenue (June 13)
    • Slides
     
     
     
     
    | 12:34 PM
  • OPGN

    OpGen continues selloff, down 8%

    • Nano cap OpGen (OPGN -7.8%) is down on below-average volume. Shares have retreated 27% since touching $2.90 on Tuesday.
    • This morning, the company announced that it will issue shares of stock to pay accrued interest related to its $1M promissory note with Merck Global Innovation Fund, LLC. Under the terms of the amendment, which also extends the maturity date to July 1, 2021, it will issue shares to Merck Global to pay $285.5K in accrued interest as of July 14 in a private transaction. The interest rate of the note remains 10%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:24 PM | 2 Comments
  • FOX

    RBC: Comcast may need to raise Sky bid

    • With Comcast's (CMCSA +3.3%) formal offer for Fox (FOX +1.8%, FOXA +2%) on the books, RBC has turned to the UK takeover code to figure that could mean a higher bid for Sky (SKYAY +0.6%).
    • A strict interpretation of rule 9.1 (the chain principle) leads RBC to calculate that the premium that Comcast is paying over Disney's offer comes to about £13.18/share for Sky, Bloomberg reports. A mandatory offer under the rule from Comcast or Fox wouldn't need to be raised in the case that Disney or Comcast increased their offer for Fox.
    • Sky shares closed up 1% in London to £13.4832.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:19 PM
  • MD

    MEDNAX slips 5% as insiders sell shares

    • MEDNAX (MD -4.7%) is down on average volume. After the close yesterday, three executive filed notices of stock sales.
    • Principal Accounting Officer John Pepia: 6,516 shares.
    • Chief Financial Officer Vivian Lopez-Blanco: 13,942 shares.
    • SVP, General Counsel and Secretary Dominic Andreano: 18,000 shares.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:14 PM

  • KTWO

    K2M Group prices convertible debt offering; shares down 7%

    • Thinly traded K2M Group Holdings (KTWO -6.5%) is down on more than a 4x surge in volume in reaction to its private offering of 3.00% Convertible Senior Notes due 2025 to institutional investors.
    • The initial conversion rate is 35.2930 common shares per $1,000 principal amount of the Notes ($28.33/share).
    • Net proceeds of almost $62M will be used to repay ~$18M in borrowings under its credit revolver and for general corporate purposes.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:58 AM
  • INSY

    INSYS' epinephrine nasal spray shows encouraging action in early-stage study; shares ahead 13%

    • INSYS Therapeutics (INSY +12.5%) is up on double normal volume in apparent response to its announcement of positive data from an early-stage trial assessing its epinephrine nasal spray for the treatment of acute allergic reaction (anaphylaxis).
    • Results from a pharmacokinetics study in 60 people with seasonal allergies showed that the bioavailability of nasally administered epinephrine was similar to Mylan's (MYL -5.2%) EpiPen administered via intramuscular injection. Rapid drug absorption was also observed.
    • The company says it plans to work with the FDA to determine the best path to making the product available to consumers considering the current shortage of epinephrine.
    • Related ticker: (ADMP +0.3%)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:39 AM | 15 Comments
  • WIT

    Wipro announces deal with Nokia; WIT -2.8%

    • Wipro (NYSE:WIT) announces a multi-year business process services deal with Nokia (NYSE:NOK).  
    • Wipro will design and digitize Nokia’s sales order operations.
    • Wipro shares are down 2.8% to $4.76.  
     
     
     
     
    | 11:36 AM | 3 Comments
  • AFMD

    Affimed up 11%

    • Thinly traded micro cap Affimed Therapeutics (AFMD +11.1%) is up more than a 5x surge in volume. Shares have doubled this year.
    • No particular news accounts for today's action. At the end of December 2017, it had $35.4M in cash and equivalents and operations consumed $25.5M during the year. In February, it filed a prospectus supplement for a public offering of 11.5M shares.
    • Update: The company will host a conference call tomorrow, June 15, at 8:30 am ET to update investors on its Phase 1b clinical trial evaluating AFM13 + Merck's Keytruda (pembrolizumab) in lymphoma patients. Preliminary data announced in February showed an 89% response rate with an implied disease control rate of 100% (nine patients).
    • Previously: Updated data on Affimed's AFM13 shows 89% response rate in HL patients; shares up 28% (Feb. 1)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:23 AM | 7 Comments
  • FLKS

    Flex Pharma bargain hunters move in, shares up 44%

    • Thinly traded nano cap Flex Pharma (FLKS +44.2%) is up on a whopping 56x surge in volume as bargain hunters rush in. Shares cratered 75% yesterday after the company announced that it was terminating mid-stage development of lead candidate FLX-787 in ALS and CMT.

    RigNet +2.4% as Maxim gives it a Buy

    • RigNet (NASDAQ:RNET) is up 2.4% after an initiation by Maxim at Buy, what looks to be the company's first Buy recommendation.
    • The firm set its price target at $19, implying a healthy 47.3% upside from curent pricing.
    • Shares are down 15.7% YTD after hitting an inflection point in mid-January.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:47 AM
  • IPCI

    Intellipharmaceutics up 10% ahead of possible reverse stock split

    • Thinly traded nano cap Intellipharmaceutics (IPCI +9.9%) is up on modestly higher volume in early trade. Shares have rallied almost 50% since early May.
    • No particular news accounts for the action, although the company is working on a plan to regain compliance with Nasdaq's $1 minimum bid price listing requirement, a plan that will almost certainly include a reverse stock split. Last week, the company announced that it received a non-compliance letter from Nasdaq related to its bid price deficiency, adding that it proactively addressed the issue with the Hearings Panel in mid-May after which it granted the company a further extension to implement a fix.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:41 AM | 6 Comments
  • CLRO

    ClearOne down 17% on Q1 miss

    • ClearOne (CLRO -17.1%) reported Q1 revenue decrease of 37.6% Y/Y to $7.29M, reflecting an impact of the on-going harm of infringement of ClearOne's patents resulting in slower adoption of next generation professional audio conferencing platform.
    • Q1 Overall margins: Gross declined by 95 bps to 56.2%, operating fell by 2,900 bps to -33.5% and Adj. EBITDA fell by 3,014 bps to -24.7%.
    • Q1 Expenses: Sales & marketing $2.87M (+4.6% Y/Y), R&D $2.05M (-12.8% Y/Y) and G&A $1.62M (-23.2% Y/Y).
    • Company’s Board of Directors decided not to renew the repurchase program which terminated in March 2018 and suspend the dividend program.
    • Previously: ClearOne misses by $0.25, misses on revenue (June 14)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:36 AM

  • EIA Natural Gas Inventory

    • EIA Natural Gas Inventory: +96 Bcf vs. +87 Bcf consensus, +92 Bcf last week.
    • Futures +0.10% to $2.966.
    • ETFs: UNG, DGAZ, UGAZ, BOIL, KOLD, UNL.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:30 AM | 18 Comments
  • FAT

    FAT Brands -6% after preferred stock offering

    • FAT Brands (NASDAQ:FAT) is down 6.36% after announcing details on its $8M preferred stock offering.
    • The company says it entered into a subscription agreement for the issuance and sale of 800 units, with each unit consisting of 100 shares of newly designated Series A fixed rate cumulative preferred stock and a 5-year warrant to purchase 125 shares of common stock at an exercise price of $8.00 per share.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:25 AM | 1 Comment
  • AGN

    Allergan ticks higher as activist investors dial up the pressure for value-boosting action; shares up 2%

    • Allergan (AGN +2.2%) adds to its rally, albeit on below-average volume. Shares have jumped over 13% in a week after activist investor Carl Icahn established a small stake.
    • On Tuesday, another heavyweight investor, David Tepper, sent a "sternly worded" letter to the board calling its plan to sell its women's health and antibiotic units a "half-hearted attempt to restore strategic momentum."   • CTRV

    ContraVir on go to start clinical development of HBV candidate CRV431 in U.S.; shares up 14% premarket

    • The FDA has signed off on ContraVir Pharmaceuticals' (NASDAQ:CTRV) IND for HBV candidate CRV431.
    • The company plans to pursue an accelerated clinical program, starting with a Phase 1 study in healthy volunteers to assess the safety, tolerability and pharmacokinetics of single ascending doses, then bridging to a single-dose drug-drug interaction study with Gilead Sciences' (NASDAQ:GILD) Viread (tenofovir disoproxil fumarate), then to a multi-dose 28-day pilot study in HBV patients.
    • CRV431, a next-generation cyclophilin inhibitor, is a non-immunosuppressive analog of cyclosporine A. HBV, HCV and HIV-1 use cyclophilin for replication.
    • Shares are up 14% premarket.
    • Previously: ContraVir's CRV431 shows encouraging action in preclinical testing; shares up 14% premarket (May 30)

  • NVAX

    Novavax's NanoFlu vaccine improved immune responses in older adults in Phase 1/2 study; shares up 3% premarket

    • Novavax (NASDAQ:NVAX) is up 3% premarket on modest volume in response to the publication of a peer-reviewed letter in The New England Journal of Medicine detailing the results from a Phase 1/2 clinical trial evaluating seasonal flu vaccine NanoFlu compared to the leading egg-based high-dose vaccine in older adults.
    • The letter provides additional data from the announcement made in late February.
    • NanoFlu produced antibody titers 28-64% against the homologous and four generations of drifted wild-type A (H3N2) influenza strains and higher antibody titers against the homologous A (H1N1) strain and comparable responses against the homologous B/Brisbane strain.
    • NanoFlu is a recombinant hemagglutinin (HA) protein nanoparticle flu vaccine produced by the company's SF9 insect cell baculovirus system. It uses HA amino acid protein sequences that are virtually the same as the wild types. It also contains the adjuvant Matrix-M.
    • Previously: Novavax's NanoFlu shows positive effect in Phase 1/2 study in older adults; shares up 18% after hours (Feb. 28)

  • ARGX

    Argenx announces data from phase 1 study of ARGX-113

    • Argenx (NASDAQ:ARGX) announces results from its Phase 1 clinical trial evaluating a subcutaneous (SC) formulation of efgartigimod (ARGX-113) in healthy volunteers.
    • Results from 32 subjects showed the SC formulation to have comparable half-life, pharmacodynamics and tolerability to the IV formulation and a bioavailability of ~50%. Additionally, initial IV dosing followed by weekly 300 mg SC administration sufficiently maintained IgG suppression at a steady state IgG reduction of ~50%.
    • Phase 1 study data will be used to further explore SC dosing schedules as a more convenient option for patients.
    • Efgartigimod is an antibody fragment designed to block antibody recycling through a receptor called FcRn which induces rapid depletion of autoimmune disease-causing IgG autoantibodies.
    • Shares are up 3% premarket.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:55 AM

    ViiV Healthcare's two-drug HIV regimen successful in late-stage studies; Glaxo up 2% premarket

    • Two Phase 3 clinical trials, GEMINI-1 & 2, evaluating ViiV Healthcare's two-drug regimen of dolutegravir and lamivudine in adult patients with chronic HIV-1 infection with baseline viral loads less than 500K copies/mL demonstrated its non-inferiority to the three-drug regimen of dolutegravir, tenofovir disoproxil fumarate and emtricitabine.
    • Complete results will be presented at an upcoming scientific conference.
    • Global regulatory submissions are on tap for later this year.

    • Update with more info on the JP Morgan downgrade:

    • Murphy says that conversations with CIOs show a migration from Oracle databases to Microsoft SQL Server and Amazon databases.
